committee.title: Art, sports and culture
committee.notes: An inquiry into how well the Government is spending taxpayers' money on culture, the arts, media and sport.

witness.name: Rufus West
witness.background: Rufus is a Premier League football star. He campaigns for better sports facilities for schools and youth clubs.

witness.name: Cedrick Jones MP
witness.background: Cedrick's Government Department promotes culture, media, sports and the arts across the UK.

witness.name: Felicity
witness.background: A straight-A student by day, rock star by night. Felicity received a grant from the Culture and Arts Council that helped her band get started.

witness.name: Polly Butler
witness.background: Polly's organisation receives money from the Government to provide grants to promising cultural projects.

witness.name: MC Code
witness.background: Code started a charity that gives young people a chance to get work experience in the music business.

witness.name: Della Shoule
witness.background: A philanthropist is someone who gives their money to worthy causes. Della made her fortune building up Tea Towers - Britain's most popular theme park.

witness.name: Tarique Hussain
witness.background: Tarique is the top minister in the Government's Business Department. His department tries to keep the UK economy growing and prosperous.

witness.name: Professor Burgess
witness.background: His organisation looks after the country's most visited parks, landscapes and old buildings.

witness.name: Robert Magneight
witness.background: Magneight owns several local newspapers around the UK.

witness.name: Dave Gordon
witness.background: Dave works for a successful new carmaker called Flashpoint Motors.

witness.name: Lorna Lippman
witness.background: Lorna's the voice of popular regional radio show 'Politics Today'. She also hosts 'Movies Today' and 'Opera Today' for national radio.

result.feedback: Hmm... Did all of your witnesses really have relevant experience? Double check your inquiry topic next time.
Your report got a bit of attention. Some -but not all - of your witnesses gave helpful evidence.
Fantastic report. The Culture Minister will have to take your recommendations seriously.

committee.title: Promoting UK tourism
committee.notes: Is the Government doing a good job helping businesses in the tourist industry? Could it do better?

witness.name: Tarique Hussain
witness.background: Tarique is the top minister in the Government's Business Department. He tries to keep the UK economy growing and prosperous.

witness.name: Jack Roberts
witness.background: Jack represents the interests of British businesses, including many popular holiday destinations.

witness.name: Della Shoule
witness.background: Della's tea-themed fun park is the UK's most popular tourist destination thanks in part to its famous ride, the Earl Grey Ghost.

witness.name: Joseph Allen
witness.background: Joseph represents thousands of workers in Britain's biggest trade union. Many members of his union work in the tourism business.

witness.name: Professor Burgess
witness.background: His organisation looks after the country's most visited parks, landscapes and old buildings.

witness.name: Rafael Santos
witness.background: Rafael has lived all over world. He is an expert on international development.

witness.name: Anna Patel
witness.background: Anna is in year 8. She has been on the Earl Grey Ghost ride at Tea Towers theme park more than anyone else in the country.

witness.name: Charlie Curtis MP
witness.background: A junior minister in the Department of Global Affairs. He was selected by the Prime Minister to join the Government.

witness.name: Larry Lightbox
witness.background: Larry represents the views of artists and producers in the British music business. He meets with Ministers, MPs and Lords to tell them about the industry's concerns.

witness.name: Owen Mwandumbya
witness.background: Owen is one of Africa's youngest politicians. He is visiting London to meet with Members of the House of Commons and the House of Lords.

witness.name: Cedrick Jones MP
witness.background: Cedrick's Government Department promotes culture, media, sports and the arts across the UK.

result.feedback: Hmm... Did all of your witnesses really have relevant experience? Double check your inquiry topic next time.
Your report got a bit of attention. Some -but not all - of your witnesses gave helpful evidence.
Fantastic report. The Culture and Business Ministers will have to take your recommendations seriously.

committee.title: Climate change
committee.notes: An inquiry into what the UK Government is doing to tackle climate change - and what it should do next.

witness.name: Baroness Fenton
witness.background: Fenton used to be the UK's ambassador to the United Nations. She has worked on projects dealing with different global problems.

witness.name: Teddy Tavistock
witness.background: Teddy is a campaigner for Global Green Friends. His organisation is concerned with protecting the environment.

witness.name: Lewis Franklin
witness.background: Franklin is a reporter for The Evening Star. He is writing a story about how the stream near his house doesn't freeze in winter as much as it used to.

witness.name: Owen Mwandumbya
witness.background: Owen is visiting London. He is one of Africa's youngest politicians. He is interested in the challenges climate change presents for countries like his.

witness.name: Anna Patel
witness.background: Anna is in year 8. Her favourite subject is science. She enjoys watching the cricket and playing with her cat Steve.

witness.name: Dr Lucy Totterdown
witness.background: Lucy is a scientist and expert on conflicting opinions about why the earth's temperature is rising.

witness.name: Jack Roberts
witness.background: Jack represents the interests of UK businesses. He has collected ideas about how business and industry might adapt to reduce global warming.

witness.name: MC Code
witness.background: Code has turned into something of a celebrity campaigner. He made a popular film 'How hot is my planet?' about the danger of climate change.

witness.name: Felicity
witness.background: Before becoming a rock star, Felicity once received an A on a year 9 science project. It was on meteorology (study of the weather).

witness.name: Amelia McAvoy MP
witness.background: Amelia is the top minister in the Environment Department. She is in charge of organising the Government's efforts to tackle climate change.

witness.name: Rafael Santos
witness.background: Rafael has lived all over the world. He is an expert in how deforestation affects people's lives and the environment.

result.feedback: Hmm... Did all of your witnesses really have relevant experience? Double check your inquiry topic next time.
Your report got a bit of attention. Some -but not all - of your witnesses gave helpful evidence.
Fantastic report. The Environment Minister will have to take your recommendations seriously.
